original: rnam gsum kun slong bcas pa ni //🔽yig 'bru brgya dang bgrang bcas pa'i //
analyzed: rnam gsum kun slong bcas pa ni // yig 'bru brgya dang bgrang bcas pa'i //
translated: is the three types of karma with motivation.🔽The three types of karma are like the four types of poetry:

original: snyan ngag grangs ti go rims bzhin //
analyzed: snyan ngag grangs ti go rims bzhin //
translated: syllabic prosody, quantitative prosody, and mixed prosody.

original: bsgribs ngan kha na ma tho bcas //🔽nyan mongs can chos dri med dge //
analyzed: bsgribs ngan kha na ma tho bcas // nyan mongs can chos dri med dge //

original: gya nom 'dus byas dge bsten bya //
analyzed: gya nom 'dus byas dge bsten bya //
translated: The sublime is virtuous, compounded, and to be relied upon.

original: thar pa bla na med pa yin //🔽chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las //
analyzed: thar pa bla na med pa yin // chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las //
translated: Liberation is unexcelled.🔽This concludes the fourth chapter, on the presentation of karma,

original: las bstan pa zhes bya ba ste gnas bzhi pa'o /🔽// / srid pa'i rtsa ba phra rgyas @16a * //
analyzed: las bstan pa zhes bya ba ste gnas bzhi pa'o / // / srid pa'i rtsa ba phra rgyas @16a * //
translated: in the Treatise on the Treasury of Abhidharma.🔽The root of existence is the six negative tendencies.

original: drug /'dod chags de bzhin khong khro dang / nga rgyal ma rig lta ba dang // the tshom yin te de drug kyang //
analyzed: drug /'dod chags de bzhin khong khro dang / nga rgyal ma rig lta ba dang // the tshom yin te de drug kyang //
translated: Desire, anger, pride, ignorance, view, and doubt.

original: 'dod chags dbye bas bdun du bshad //
analyzed: 'dod chags dbye bas bdun du bshad //
translated: Attachment is explained as sevenfold by way of its divisions.

original: khams gnyis las skyes srid 'dod chags //
analyzed: khams gnyis las skyes srid 'dod chags //
translated: Attachment to existence is born from the two realms.

original: kha ni nang du bltas phyir der //
analyzed: kha ni nang du bltas phyir der //
translated: It is explained to be that because it is turned inward.

original: thar pa'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
analyzed: thar pa'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
translated: It is explained to be that in order to stop the conception of liberation.🔽There are five views: the view of the transitory collection,🔽wrong views, the view grasping an extreme,

original: lta ba lnga ste 'jig tshogs dang // log dang mthar 'dzin lta ba dang // lta ba dang ni tshul khrims dang // brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin dang bcu //
analyzed: lta ba lnga ste 'jig tshogs dang // log dang mthar 'dzin lta ba dang // lta ba dang ni tshul khrims dang // brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin dang bcu //
translated: and the overesteeming of: morality and asceticism, and🔽inferiority.

original: de dag bcu dang bdun bdun brgyad //
analyzed: de dag bcu dang bdun bdun brgyad //
translated: They are ten, seven, seven, and eight.

original: lta ba gsum gnyis ma gtogs pa //🔽'dod na sdug bsngal la sogs pa ;
analyzed: lta ba gsum gnyis ma gtogs pa // 'dod na sdug bsngal la sogs pa ;
translated: Except for three and two views.🔽In the desire realm, the views of

original: / mthong bas rim bzhin spong bar byed //
analyzed: / mthong bas rim bzhin spong bar byed //
translated: the transitory collection, and of holding a view as paramount are abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and so on in order.

original: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
analyzed: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
translated: Four are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: khong khro ma gtogs de dag nyid //
analyzed: khong khro ma gtogs de dag nyid //
translated: Those same views except for anger

original: gzugs khams gzugs med de dang 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs khams gzugs med de dang 'dra //
translated: are the same in the form and formless realms.

original: de ltar dgu bcu brgyad du 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar dgu bcu brgyad du 'dod //
translated: Thus they are asserted to be ninety eight.🔽The objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing

original: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis //🔽gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid//
analyzed: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis // gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid//
translated: that arise in the summit of existence are destroyed by the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: lhag skyes mthong dang bsgom gnyis kyis //
analyzed: lhag skyes mthong dang bsgom gnyis kyis //
translated: Those that arise in other levels are objects to be abandoned by both the path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: bzod pas gzhom min bsgom kho nas //
analyzed: bzod pas gzhom min bsgom kho nas //
translated: They are not to be overcome by patience, but only by meditation.🔽The view of self and “mine” as permanent or annihilated,🔽As nonexistent, as inferior or as supreme,

original: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // med dang dman la mchog lta dang // rgyu min lam min der lta ba //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // med dang dman la mchog lta dang // rgyu min lam min der lta ba //
translated: And as cause or path, when they are not,

original: de dag lta ba lnga yin no //
analyzed: de dag lta ba lnga yin no //
translated: Are the five views.

original: dbang phyug sogs rgyur mngon zhen pa //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs rgyur mngon zhen pa //
translated: The manifest clinging to Īśvara and so on as the cause

original: rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis //🔽rab tu 'jug pas de phyir de //
analyzed: rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis // rab tu 'jug pas de phyir de //
translated: Is the view of permanence and self,🔽And it is the cause of the other views.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya nyid //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya nyid //
translated: Therefore it is abandoned by seeing suffering.🔽The three views are distorted,🔽The four are distorted, and the view of the transitory collection is distorted,

original: lta ba gsum las phyin ci log / bzhi tshan phyin ci log phyir dang // nges rtog phyir dang sgro 'dogs phyir //
analyzed: lta ba gsum las phyin ci log / bzhi tshan phyin ci log phyir dang // nges rtog phyir dang sgro 'dogs phyir //
translated: Because it is a definite conception and an overestimation.

original: sems dang 'du shes de'i dbang gis //
analyzed: sems dang 'du shes de'i dbang gis //
translated: The mind and discernment are under its power.

original: nga rgyal bdun rnam dgu gsum po ;🔽/ mthong dang bsgom pas zad bya ba //
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun rnam dgu gsum po ; / mthong dang bsgom pas zad bya ba //
translated: The seven types of pride are of nine types and three types.🔽They are to be abandoned by seeing and meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni //
translated: Those to be abandoned by the path of meditation

original: gsod stsogs kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: gsod stsogs kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: Are the entanglements of killing and so on.🔽Likewise, the āryas do not have

original: de bzhin 'jig sred 'phags pa la //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig sred 'phags pa la //
translated: The view of annihilation, craving for desire realm objects,

original: rnam sogs nga'o snyam mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam sogs nga'o snyam mi 'byung //
translated: Or the conceit “I am,” and so on.

original: lta bas rgyas par 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bas rgyas par 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: They increase through view.

original: mi dge'i 'gyod pa'ang ma yin no //🔽sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
analyzed: mi dge'i 'gyod pa'ang ma yin no // sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
translated: It is not nonvirtuous regret.🔽The pervasive proclivities🔽are the afflicted view of the self,

original: lta dang de bzhin the tshom dang // gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
analyzed: lta dang de bzhin the tshom dang // gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
translated: the afflicted view of the extremes,

original: ma rig gang yin kun tu 'gro //
analyzed: ma rig gang yin kun tu 'gro //
translated: and the ignorance that is not associated with those.

original: de dag las dgu gong du dmigs //
analyzed: de dag las dgu gong du dmigs //
translated: Nine of them focus on higher realms.

original: lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so //
translated: The two views are excluded.

original: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
analyzed: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
translated: The ignorance that is associated with them🔽and that which is independent is also pervasive.

original: 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
translated: The obtainment of those is not pervasive.🔽The objects abandoned by seeing

original: 'gog dang @16b lam mthong spang bya ba //
analyzed: 'gog dang @16b lam mthong spang bya ba //
translated: the truths of cessation and path🔽are the afflicted view of the self,🔽the extreme, and doubt,🔽and the ignorance that is associated with them,🔽and the independent ignorance.

original: log lta the tshom de dag dang // ldan dang 'ba' zhig ma rig dang // drug ni zag med spyod yul can //
analyzed: log lta the tshom de dag dang // ldan dang 'ba' zhig ma rig dang // drug ni zag med spyod yul can //
translated: These six have the uncontaminated as their object field.🔽The cessation and path of one’s own level

original: rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa dang // lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa dang // lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas //
translated: are the objects of the six.

original: sa drug sa dgu'i lam ni de'i //
analyzed: sa drug sa dgu'i lam ni de'i //
translated: The path of the six levels and the nine levels

original: spyod yul can gyi yul yin no //🔽'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
analyzed: spyod yul can gyi yul yin no // 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
translated: is the object field of those.🔽They are not desire because they are abandoned.

original: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
analyzed: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
translated: They are not anger because they do not harm.

original: zhi dang dag dang mchog gyur phyir //
analyzed: zhi dang dag dang mchog gyur phyir //
translated: They are not confusion because they are peaceful and pure.

original: nga rgyal ma yin mchog 'dzin min //
analyzed: nga rgyal ma yin mchog 'dzin min //
translated: It is not pride, nor is it a form of clinging.

original: phra rgyas kun tu 'gro rnams ni //
analyzed: phra rgyas kun tu 'gro rnams ni //
translated: It is not pride, nor is it the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices.🔽The pervasive negative tendencies

original: dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa //🔽thams cad du ni rgyas par 'gyur //🔽kun 'gro ma yin rang ris su//
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa // thams cad du ni rgyas par 'gyur // kun 'gro ma yin rang ris su//
translated: pervade their own level.🔽The nonpervasive negative tendencies

original: zag med gong ma'i yul can min //
analyzed: zag med gong ma'i yul can min //
translated: do not pervade the uncontaminated and higher levels.

original: bdag gir ma byas gnyen po'i phyir //🔽gang zhig gang dang mtshungs ldan pa //
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas gnyen po'i phyir // gang zhig gang dang mtshungs ldan pa //
translated: They do not pervade that which is not taken as mine and that which is an antidote.🔽That which is concomitant with a particular negative tendency

original: de ni der mtshungs ldan sgo nas //
analyzed: de ni der mtshungs ldan sgo nas //
translated: is pervaded by it.

original: gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan //
analyzed: gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan //
translated: All higher levels are neutral.🔽In the desire realm, the afflicted view of the self,

original: 'dod na 'jig tshogs lta ba dang // mthar 'dzin lhan cig ma rig pa //
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig tshogs lta ba dang // mthar 'dzin lhan cig ma rig pa //
translated: the extreme view, and the ignorance concomitant with them

original: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o //
translated: are nonvirtuous.🔽In the desire realm, attachment, anger, and delusion

original: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin //
translated: are the roots of nonvirtue.

original: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
translated: The three roots of neutral states

original: de ne srid dang ma rig blo //
analyzed: de ne srid dang ma rig blo //
translated: are craving, ignorance, and discernment.

original: rnam gnyis mthor 'jug phyir de las //
analyzed: rnam gnyis mthor 'jug phyir de las //
translated: Since they engage the higher realms,🔽they are not the roots of nonvirtue.

original: gzhan min bzhi zhes nyi 'og pa //
analyzed: gzhan min bzhi zhes nyi 'og pa //
translated: The Aparāntakas say that there are four🔽that are not like that.

original: de dag sred lta nga rgyal rmongs //
analyzed: de dag sred lta nga rgyal rmongs //
translated: They are craving, view, pride, and delusion.

original: bsam gtan pa gsum ma rig las //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa gsum ma rig las //
translated: The three contemplations are due to ignorance.🔽The answers are: a single answer, a differentiated answer,

original: mgo gcig dang ni rnam phye dang // dri dang gzhag par lung bstan pa //
analyzed: mgo gcig dang ni rnam phye dang // dri dang gzhag par lung bstan pa //
translated: an answer through a question, and an answer through setting aside.

original: 'chi dang skye dang khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: 'chi dang skye dang khyad par 'phags //
translated: Death, birth, and superiority.

original: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
analyzed: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
translated: They are like the views of self, other, and so on.🔽Attachment to the past and present,🔽anger and pride

original: 'das dang nyer gnas 'dod chags dang // khong khro nga rgyal dag gis ni ;
analyzed: 'das dang nyer gnas 'dod chags dang // khong khro nga rgyal dag gis ni ;
translated: are possessed by those

original: / gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i //🔽dngos po de dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: / gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i // dngos po de dang ldan pa yin /
translated: who have not abandoned the things that give rise to them.

original: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas //
analyzed: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas //
translated: The future ones of the mental faculty

original: kun dang gzhan gyis rang dus pa //
analyzed: kun dang gzhan gyis rang dus pa //
translated: are possessed by all, and by others in one's own time.🔽Those not arising are possessed by all,

original: mi skye rnams kyis thams cad dang // lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan //
analyzed: mi skye rnams kyis thams cad dang // lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan //
translated: and by the remaining ones in all ways.

original: dus rnams kun tu yod gsungs phyir //
analyzed: dus rnams kun tu yod gsungs phyir //
translated: Because it is said to exist in all times,

original: gnyis phyir yul yod phyir 'bras phyir //
analyzed: gnyis phyir yul yod phyir 'bras phyir //
translated: because of the two, because of the object, and because of the result,🔽because of the assertion of its existence,

original: de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad //
analyzed: de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad //
translated: all are asserted to be proponents of existence.🔽They are the four: proponents of entities, proponents of characteristics,

original: yod par smra bar 'dod de dag / rnam bzhi dngos dang mtshan nyid dang // gnas skabs gzhan gzhan 'gyur zhes bya /
analyzed: yod par smra bar 'dod de dag / rnam bzhi dngos dang mtshan nyid dang // gnas skabs gzhan gzhan 'gyur zhes bya /
translated: proponents of states, and proponents of transformation.

original: gsum pa bzang ste bya ba yis //
analyzed: gsum pa bzang ste bya ba yis //
translated: The third is good because of its activity.

original: dus rnams rnam gzhag gegs su byed //🔽de yang ji ltar @17a * //
analyzed: dus rnams rnam gzhag gegs su byed // de yang ji ltar @17a * //
translated: Time is not a hindrance to them.

original: gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin //
translated: How is it that they are not other?

original: dus su mi rung de bzhin du //
analyzed: dus su mi rung de bzhin du //
translated: Just as time is not a hindrance,🔽if they exist, why are they not produced?

original: yod na ci phyir ma skyes zhig / chos nyid dag ni zab pa yin //
analyzed: yod na ci phyir ma skyes zhig / chos nyid dag ni zab pa yin //
translated: The reality of phenomena is profound.

original: sdug bsngal mthong spang bya spangs kyang //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong spang bya spangs kyang //
translated: Though objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are abandoned,

original: kun 'gro lhag ma rnams kyis ldan //
analyzed: kun 'gro lhag ma rnams kyis ldan //
translated: one possesses the remaining pervasive negative tendencies.

original: dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i //
analyzed: dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i //
translated: Though the first aspect is abandoned,

original: yul can dri ma lhag rnams kyis ;
analyzed: yul can dri ma lhag rnams kyis ;
translated: one possesses the remaining stains that are its objects.

original: / sdug bsngal rgyu mthong goms pa yis //
analyzed: / sdug bsngal rgyu mthong goms pa yis //
translated: Objects to be abandoned by seeing the cause of suffering and by the path of meditation

original: spang bya 'dod khams las skyes pa //
analyzed: spang bya 'dod khams las skyes pa //
translated: that arise in the desire realm

original: rang gi gsum dang gzugs gtogs gcig / dri med rnam shes spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rang gi gsum dang gzugs gtogs gcig / dri med rnam shes spyod yul lo //
translated: are the domain of the three of its level and one of the form realm.🔽Those that arise in the form realm are the domain of its three,

original: gzugs khams las skyes rang gi dang // 'og gsum gong gcig dri med kyi'ang //🔽gzugs med las skyes khams gsum gtogs //
analyzed: gzugs khams las skyes rang gi dang // 'og gsum gong gcig dri med kyi'ang // gzugs med las skyes khams gsum gtogs //
translated: one of the lower level and one of the formless realm and also of the uncontaminated.🔽Those that arise in the formless realm are the domain of the three of its level

original: gsum dang zag med spyod yul lo //
analyzed: gsum dang zag med spyod yul lo //
translated: and the uncontaminated.

original: 'gog dang lam mthong spang bya kun //
analyzed: 'gog dang lam mthong spang bya kun //
translated: All objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path

original: rang gis glags pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rang gis glags pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: are the domain of their own level.

original: zag med khams gsum mtha' gsum dang // zag pa med pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: zag med khams gsum mtha' gsum dang // zag pa med pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The uncontaminated element is the three ends and the object of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: nyon mongs phra rgyas bcas rnam gnyis ;
analyzed: nyon mongs phra rgyas bcas rnam gnyis ;
translated: Afflictions are of two types: with and without proclivities.

original: / nyon mongs can min rgyas 'gyur gyis //🔽rmongs las the tshom de nas ni //
analyzed: / nyon mongs can min rgyas 'gyur gyis // rmongs las the tshom de nas ni //
translated: Those that increase without being afflictive🔽From delusion, doubt; from that,

original: log lta de nas 'jig tshogs lta //
analyzed: log lta de nas 'jig tshogs lta //
translated: wrong views; from that, the view of the perishable collection;

original: de nas mthar 'dzin de nas ni //
analyzed: de nas mthar 'dzin de nas ni //
translated: from that, the view grasping an extreme; from that,🔽the view holding to an extreme; from that,

original: tshul khrims mchog 'dzin de nas lta //
analyzed: tshul khrims mchog 'dzin de nas lta //
translated: pride in ethics and rituals; from that,

original: rang gi lta la nga rgyal chags //
analyzed: rang gi lta la nga rgyal chags //
translated: attachment to one's own views;

original: gzhan la zhe sdang de ltar rim //
analyzed: gzhan la zhe sdang de ltar rim //
translated: hatred towards others' views.🔽The causes of afflictions are🔽not abandoning the proclivities,🔽the object being present,

original: phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang // yul ni nye bar gnas pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed las //🔽nyon mongs rgyu ni tshang ba yin //
analyzed: phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang // yul ni nye bar gnas pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed las // nyon mongs rgyu ni tshang ba yin //
translated: and improper mental activity.

original: 'dod na gti mug ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod na gti mug ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: In the desire realm, except for delusion,🔽all afflictions with entanglements are contaminations.

original: nyon mongs kun nas dkris bcas zag / gzugs dang gzugs ni med pa na //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun nas dkris bcas zag / gzugs dang gzugs ni med pa na //
translated: In the form and formless realms,🔽only proclivities are contaminations of existence.

original: phra rgyas kho na srid pa'i zag / de lung ma bstan kha nang bltas //
analyzed: phra rgyas kho na srid pa'i zag / de lung ma bstan kha nang bltas //
translated: They are neutral, internal,

original: mnyam gzhag sa pa'i phyir gcig byas //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag sa pa'i phyir gcig byas //
translated: and one is made by the level of equipoise.

original: rtsa ba ma rig yin pas na //
analyzed: rtsa ba ma rig yin pas na //
translated: Since ignorance is the root,

original: logs shig tu ni zag par bstan //
analyzed: logs shig tu ni zag par bstan //
translated: it is taught separately as a contaminant.

original: chu bo sbyor ba'ang de bzhin du //
analyzed: chu bo sbyor ba'ang de bzhin du //
translated: The floods and bonds are also like that.

original: lha rnams gsal phyir logs shig bstan //
analyzed: lha rnams gsal phyir logs shig bstan //
translated: The gods are taught separately because they are clear.

original: zag par ma yin grogs med rnams //
analyzed: zag par ma yin grogs med rnams //
translated: Those without companions are not contaminants.

original: 'jog pa'i rjes su mi mthun lo //
analyzed: 'jog pa'i rjes su mi mthun lo //
translated: They are placed separately because they are not compatible.

original: ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas //
analyzed: ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas //
translated: As explained, they are possessed by ignorance.

original: nyer len rnams te lta rnam gnyis //
analyzed: nyer len rnams te lta rnam gnyis //
translated: The views are twofold because they are distinguished.

original: phye ba'i phyir ro ma rig pa //🔽'dzin par byed pa min phyir bsres //
analyzed: phye ba'i phyir ro ma rig pa // 'dzin par byed pa min phyir bsres //
translated: Since ignorance is not a grasping, it is mixed.🔽Because they are subtle, because they are both related and extensive,

original: gang phyir de dag phra ba dang // rjes 'brel rnam gnyis rgyas 'gyur dang // rjes @17b su 'brang bas de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir de dag phra ba dang // rjes 'brel rnam gnyis rgyas 'gyur dang // rjes @17b su 'brang bas de yi phyir //
translated: and because they are related,

original: phra rgyas dag tu bshad pa yin //
analyzed: phra rgyas dag tu bshad pa yin //
translated: they are explained as the proclivities.🔽They are contaminants because they place, contaminate,

original: de dag 'jog byed zag byed dang // 'khyer bar byed dang 'byar byed dang // nye bar 'dzin phyir zag la sogs //
analyzed: de dag 'jog byed zag byed dang // 'khyer bar byed dang 'byar byed dang // nye bar 'dzin phyir zag la sogs //
translated: carry away, adhere, and closely hold.

original: de dag gi ni nges tshig yin //🔽de dag kun tu sbyor sogs kyi //
analyzed: de dag gi ni nges tshig yin // de dag kun tu sbyor sogs kyi //
translated: These are their definitions.🔽They are also explained as five because of the classifications

original: dbye bas yang rnam lngar bshad do ;
analyzed: dbye bas yang rnam lngar bshad do ;
translated: of the fetters and so on.

original: / rdzas dang mchog 'dzin 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: / rdzas dang mchog 'dzin 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is similar to the grasping of things and the grasping of the highest.🔽

original: lta gnyis kun tu sbyor gzhan no //
analyzed: lta gnyis kun tu sbyor gzhan no //
translated: The two views are a separate fetter,🔽because they grasp at substantiality and the highest.

original: gang phyir gnyis ka'ang gcig tu ni //
analyzed: gang phyir gnyis ka'ang gcig tu ni //
translated: Because both are independent,

original: mi dge rang dbang de yi phyir //🔽phrag dog ser sna de dag las //
analyzed: mi dge rang dbang de yi phyir // phrag dog ser sna de dag las //
translated: non-virtue is a separate fetter.🔽Jealousy and miserliness are separate fetters

original: logs shig kun sbyor gnyis su bshad //
analyzed: logs shig kun sbyor gnyis su bshad //
translated: because they are the opposites of those two.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun rnam lnga //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun rnam lnga //
translated: The five that correspond to the lower realms

original: gnyis kyis 'dod las mi 'da' la //
analyzed: gnyis kyis 'dod las mi 'da' la //
translated: are the two that do not transcend desire.🔽The three that correspond to the higher realms

original: gsum po yis ni phyir zlog byed //
analyzed: gsum po yis ni phyir zlog byed //
translated: are the three that cause one to return.🔽The three that correspond to the path

original: sgo dang rtsa bas bsdus phyir gsum //🔽'gro mi 'dod dang lam nor dang // lam la the tshom de snyed cig / thar pa bgrod la gegs byed pa //
analyzed: sgo dang rtsa bas bsdus phyir gsum // 'gro mi 'dod dang lam nor dang // lam la the tshom de snyed cig / thar pa bgrod la gegs byed pa //
translated: are the three that are included in the door and the root.

original: de yi phyir na gsum bstan to //
analyzed: de yi phyir na gsum bstan to //
translated: The three that correspond to the result🔽are the three that obstruct the attainment of liberation.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid //
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid //
translated: The five that correspond to the higher realms

original: gzugs dang gzugs med las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med las skyes pa'i //
translated: are the two attachments to the form and formless realms,

original: 'dod chags gnyis rgod nga rgyal rmongs //
analyzed: 'dod chags gnyis rgod nga rgyal rmongs //
translated: excitation, pride, and confusion.

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum //
translated: The three bonds are due to the power of feeling.

original: nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
analyzed: nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
translated: The other afflicted states are different from the afflictions.

original: sems byung 'du byed phung zhes pa //
analyzed: sems byung 'du byed phung zhes pa //
translated: The aggregate of formations is said to be the mental factors.

original: gang de'ang nye ba'i nyon mongs te //
analyzed: gang de'ang nye ba'i nyon mongs te //
translated: The secondary afflictions are also included in that.

original: de dag nyon mongs zhes mi bya //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs zhes mi bya //
translated: They are not called afflictions.🔽Shamelessness, lack of conscience, jealousy, stinginess, excitement,

original: ngo tsha med dang khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgod pa dang // 'gyod dang rmugs dang gnyid dang ni //
analyzed: ngo tsha med dang khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgod pa dang // 'gyod dang rmugs dang gnyid dang ni //
translated: remorse, lethargy, and sleep,

original: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad //🔽khro dang 'chab pa'o 'dod chags kyis //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad // khro dang 'chab pa'o 'dod chags kyis //
translated: these eight entanglements🔽anger and concealment.

original: ngo tsha med rgod ser sna bslang //🔽'chab pa rtsod do ma rig las ;
analyzed: ngo tsha med rgod ser sna bslang // 'chab pa rtsod do ma rig las ;
translated: Shamelessness, excitement, and stinginess are derived from attachment.

original: / rmugs dang gnyid dang khrel med do //
analyzed: / rmugs dang gnyid dang khrel med do //
translated: Concealment is disputed. Lethargy, sleep, and lack of conscience arise from ignorance.

original: the tshom las 'gyod khro ba dang // phrag dog khong khro'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: the tshom las 'gyod khro ba dang // phrag dog khong khro'i rgyu las byung //
translated: Remorse arises from doubt. Anger and jealousy arise from aversion.🔽Moreover, there are six other afflictive stains: deceit, guile, arrogance,

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug / sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang // de bzhin 'tshig dang khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe rgyu dang rgyags pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug / sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang // de bzhin 'tshig dang khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe rgyu dang rgyags pa ni //
translated: contempt, resentment, and violence.

original: 'dod chags las skyes khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe khong khro las skyes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags las skyes khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe khong khro las skyes so //
translated: Arrogance and resentment arise from attachment. Violence arises from anger.

original: 'tshig pa lta ba mchog 'dzin las //
analyzed: 'tshig pa lta ba mchog 'dzin las //
translated: Arrogance arises from the view of the supremacy of bad views.

original: g-yo ni lta bas kun nas bslang //
analyzed: g-yo ni lta bas kun nas bslang //
translated: Guile arises from the view of the supremacy of inferior states.🔽Shamelessness and lack of abashment arise from that.

original: de las ngo tsha med pa dang // khrel med rmugs gnyid rgod rnam gnyis //
analyzed: de las ngo tsha med pa dang // khrel med rmugs gnyid rgod rnam gnyis //
translated: Drowsiness and excitation are both cultivated.

original: de las gzhan ni bsgom spang bya //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni bsgom spang bya //
translated: The others are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rang dbang de bzhin @18a * //
analyzed: rang dbang de bzhin @18a * //
translated: The autonomous ones are like that.

original: dri ma rnams //
analyzed: dri ma rnams //
translated: The stains

original: 'dod na mi dge gsum rnam gnyis //
analyzed: 'dod na mi dge gsum rnam gnyis //
translated: are nonvirtuous in the desire realm, and two in the form realm.

original: de yan chad ni lung ma bstan //
analyzed: de yan chad ni lung ma bstan //
translated: Above that, they are neutral.

original: 'dod dang bsam gtan dang po na //
analyzed: 'dod dang bsam gtan dang po na //
translated: In the desire realm and the first absorption,

original: g-yo sgyu tshangs pas 'drid phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu tshangs pas 'drid phyir ro //
translated: guile and deceit are taught to be Brahma’s deception.

original: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
analyzed: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
translated: Drowsiness, excitation, and arrogance exist in the three realms.

original: gzhan dag 'dod khams las skyes pa //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'dod khams las skyes pa //
translated: The others are born in the desire realm.

original: mthong spang bya gnyid nga rgyal bcas //
analyzed: mthong spang bya gnyid nga rgyal bcas //
translated: Sleep and pride are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: yid kyi rnam shes sa pa yin //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes sa pa yin //
translated: They are associated with mental consciousness.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang yang //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang yang //
translated: The autonomous secondary afflictions

original: gzhan ni rnam shes drug rten can //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam shes drug rten can //
translated: are associated with the six consciousnesses.

original: bde ba dag dang 'dod chags su //
analyzed: bde ba dag dang 'dod chags su //
translated: Happiness and attachment

original: mtshungs ldan zhe sdang bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs ldan zhe sdang bzlog pa'o //
translated: are concomitant. Aversion is the opposite.

original: ma rig pa dag thams cad dang // med lta yid bde sdug bsngal dang // yid mi bde dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: ma rig pa dag thams cad dang // med lta yid bde sdug bsngal dang // yid mi bde dang the tshom mo //
translated: the three roots, regret, and anger🔽arise from the mental faculty.

original: gzhan yid bde dang 'dod las skyes //
analyzed: gzhan yid bde dang 'dod las skyes //
translated: The others arise from the mental faculty and from pleasure.

original: btang snyoms dad kun sa gong ma //
analyzed: btang snyoms dad kun sa gong ma //
translated: Equanimity and faith arise from all levels.🔽The others arise from their own level.🔽Regret, envy, anger,🔽harm, resentment, and spite arise from mental dissatisfaction.

original: sa ji bzhin du rang rang dang // 'gyod dang phrag dog khro ba dang // rnam 'tshe khon du 'dzin pa dang // 'tshig pa yid mi bde ba dang // ser sna dag ni bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: sa ji bzhin du rang rang dang // 'gyod dang phrag dog khro ba dang // rnam 'tshe khon du 'dzin pa dang // 'tshig pa yid mi bde ba dang // ser sna dag ni bzlog pa yin //
translated: Stinginess arises from pleasure.

original: g-yo dang sgyu dang 'chab dang gnyis //
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu dang 'chab dang gnyis //
translated: Guile, deceit, concealment, and sleep🔽arise from both mental pleasure and mental pain.

original: gnyis ka dang ldan bde dag dang // rgyags pa btang snyoms kun tu 'gro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang ldan bde dag dang // rgyags pa btang snyoms kun tu 'gro //
translated: Arrogance arises from equanimity and from all.🔽The four others arise from five.🔽The obscurations in the desire realm arise from incompatible states,

original: bzhi po gzhan ni lnga dag dang // 'dod na sgrib rnams mi mthun dang // zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bzhi po gzhan ni lnga dag dang // 'dod na sgrib rnams mi mthun dang // zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir //
translated: from the same food, and from the same action.🔽Two arise from the harm of the aggregates,

original: gnyis gcig phung po gnod byed dang // the tshom phyir na lnga nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis gcig phung po gnod byed dang // the tshom phyir na lnga nyid do //
translated: and five arise from doubt.🔽The complete knowledge of the focal object

original: dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang // de la dmigs pa yang dag par //
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang // de la dmigs pa yang dag par //
translated: and the complete knowledge of the object of abandonment

original: zad dang dmigs pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: zad dang dmigs pa spangs pas so //
translated: They are abandoned by the exhaustion of the object field and by the abandonment of the object field.

original: gnyen po skyes pas zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyen po skyes pas zad par 'gyur //
translated: They are exhausted by the arising of the antidote.🔽The antidote is fourfold: abandonment, the basis, existence, and the counteragent.

original: gnyen po rnam bzhi spong ba dang // gzhi dang srid nyid rnam par ni ;
analyzed: gnyen po rnam bzhi spong ba dang // gzhi dang srid nyid rnam par ni ;
translated: The object field is abandoned by the counteragent.

original: sun 'byin zhes bya dmigs pa las //
analyzed: sun 'byin zhes bya dmigs pa las //
translated: The defilements are considered as abandoned.🔽The counteragent is of four types:

original: nyon mongs pa ni spang byar 'dod //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni spang byar 'dod //
translated: The counteragent of abandonment is the path of abandonment of the defilements.🔽The counteragent of the basis is the physical basis of the path, the human existence of the two continents, men or women.🔽The counteragent of existence is the path of the realm of desire.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun mi mthun phyogs //🔽yul rnam chad dang dus kyis te //🔽'byung dang tshul khrims phyogs dang ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun mi mthun phyogs // yul rnam chad dang dus kyis te // 'byung dang tshul khrims phyogs dang ni //
translated: The counteragent of the aspect is the path of the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: dus gnyis ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dus gnyis ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
translated: The counteragent of time is the path of the future, for the defilements are abandoned by the future path, not by the past or present path.

original: lan cig tu zad de dag gi / bral ba'i thob pa yang dang yang //🔽gnyen po skyes dang 'bras thob dang // dbang po rnam par 'phel rnams su //🔽yongs su shes dgu 'dod pa na //
analyzed: lan cig tu zad de dag gi / bral ba'i thob pa yang dang yang // gnyen po skyes dang 'bras thob dang // dbang po rnam par 'phel rnams su // yongs su shes dgu 'dod pa na //
translated: The counteragent of the object field is the path of the abandonment of the object field.🔽The counteragent of the object field is of two types:

original: dang po rnams gnyis zad la gcig / gnyis zad pa ni de gnyis so //
analyzed: dang po rnams gnyis zad la gcig / gnyis zad pa ni de gnyis so //
translated: The counteragent of the object field of the past is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the past.🔽The counteragent of the object field of the future is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the future.

original: de bzhin gong ma'i de gsum nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gong ma'i de gsum nyid //
translated: The counteragent of the object field of the present is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the present.🔽The counteragent of the object field of the unconditioned is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the unconditioned.🔽The counteragent of the object field of the unapprehendable is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the unapprehendable.🔽The counteragent of the object field of the unapprehendable is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the unapprehendable.🔽The counteragent of the object field of the unapprehendable is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the unapprehendable.🔽The counteragent of the object field of the unapprehendable is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the unapprehendable.🔽The counteragent of the object field of the unapprehendable is the path of the abandonment of the defilements whose object is the unapprehendable.

original: yongs su shes pa @18b gzhan gsum ste //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa @18b gzhan gsum ste //
translated: The counteragent of the object

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun gzugs dang // zag pa kun zad drug bzod 'bras //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun gzugs dang // zag pa kun zad drug bzod 'bras //
translated: and the elimination of all contaminants.

original: lhag ma rnams ni shes pa'i yin //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni shes pa'i yin //
translated: The remaining are the results of knowledge.

original: mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do //
analyzed: mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do //
translated: The results of unrestricted access concentration are all.

original: bsam gtan rnams kyi lnga'am brgyad //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi lnga'am brgyad //
translated: The results of the absorptions are five or eight.

original: nye bar bsdogs pa'i gcig yin te //
analyzed: nye bar bsdogs pa'i gcig yin te //
translated: The results of access concentration are one.

original: gzugs med dngos gzhi gsum gyi yang //🔽thams cad 'phags pa'i lam gyi yin //
analyzed: gzugs med dngos gzhi gsum gyi yang // thams cad 'phags pa'i lam gyi yin //
translated: The results of the three formless realm actual bases🔽are all.🔽The results of the ārya path are two.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gnyis rjes kyi yang //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gnyis rjes kyi yang //
translated: The results of the mundane path are three.

original: chos shes pa'i ni gsum yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i ni gsum yin no //
translated: The results of Dharma knowledge are three.

original: de'i phyogs mthun gyi drug dang lnga //
analyzed: de'i phyogs mthun gyi drug dang lnga //
translated: The results of subsequent knowledge are six and five.🔽Because the obtainment of freedom is uncontaminated,🔽the summit of existence is destroyed,

original: bral ba'i thob pa zag med dang // srid rtse nyams par byas pa dang // rgyu gnyis kun tu bcom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bral ba'i thob pa zag med dang // srid rtse nyams par byas pa dang // rgyu gnyis kun tu bcom pa'i phyir //
translated: and the two causes are completely destroyed,

original: yongs shes khams las 'das pa las //
analyzed: yongs shes khams las 'das pa las //
translated: the complete knowledge of the realms is transcended.

original: gcig min mthong la gnas pa ni //
analyzed: gcig min mthong la gnas pa ni //
translated: One who abides in the path of seeing

original: lnga yi bar dang yang dag ldan //🔽bsgoms la gnas pa drug gam ni //
analyzed: lnga yi bar dang yang dag ldan // bsgoms la gnas pa drug gam ni //
translated: is endowed with five.🔽One who abides in the path of meditation

original: gcig gam yang na gnyis dang ngo //
analyzed: gcig gam yang na gnyis dang ngo //
translated: is endowed with six, one, or two.

original: khams las 'dod chags bral ba dang ; /'bras bu thob phyir de dag bsdoms //
analyzed: khams las 'dod chags bral ba dang ; /'bras bu thob phyir de dag bsdoms //
translated: They are combined because of freedom from attachment to the realms and because of the attainment of the result.

original: la la gcig gnyis lnga dang drug / gtong ste thob pa lnga min no //🔽chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las //
analyzed: la la gcig gnyis lnga dang drug / gtong ste thob pa lnga min no // chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las //
translated: Some abandon one, two, five, or six, but not five types of obtainment.

original: phra rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ste gnas drug pa'o /🔽// / bden pa mthong dang bsgoms pa las ;
analyzed: phra rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ste gnas drug pa'o / // / bden pa mthong dang bsgoms pa las ;
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, called “The Demonstration of the Contaminants.”

original: / nyon mongs spangs pa zhes bshad pa //
analyzed: / nyon mongs spangs pa zhes bshad pa //
translated: The afflictions are said to be abandoned by seeing the truths and by cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam gnyis te //
translated: The path of cultivation is twofold:

original: mthong ba zhes bya zag pa med //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya zag pa med //
translated: the path of seeing is uncontaminated.

original: bden pa dag ni bzhir bshad do //
analyzed: bden pa dag ni bzhir bshad do //
translated: The truths are explained as four:

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung de bzhin du //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung de bzhin du //
translated: suffering, origin, and likewise

original: 'gog dang lam ste de ltar na //
analyzed: 'gog dang lam ste de ltar na //
translated: cessation and the path.

original: de dag ji ltar mngon rtogs rim //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mngon rtogs rim //
translated: In that case, what is the order of their realization?

original: yid 'ong yid du mi 'ong dang // de las gzhan zag bcas rnams nyid //🔽sdug bsngal nyid gsum ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yid 'ong yid du mi 'ong dang // de las gzhan zag bcas rnams nyid // sdug bsngal nyid gsum ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: The pleasant, the unpleasant, and that which is other than that, which is contaminated,🔽are suffering because they possess the three kinds of suffering,

original: ci rigs ma lus sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: ci rigs ma lus sdug bsngal lo //
translated: as is appropriate, in their entirety.

original: gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
analyzed: gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
translated: That which is destroyed by the mind and by other things,

original: bsal na de blo mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: bsal na de blo mi 'jug pa //
translated: If it were eliminated, the mind would not engage it.

original: bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
translated: Like a pot and water, it exists conventionally.

original: yod de don dam yod gzhan no //
analyzed: yod de don dam yod gzhan no //
translated: Ultimate existence is different from that.

original: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
analyzed: tshul gnas thos dang bsam ldan pas //
translated: One who abides in ethics and possesses learning and reflection

original: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
translated: is fully engaged in meditation.

original: thos stsogs las byung blo rnams ni //
analyzed: thos stsogs las byung blo rnams ni //
translated: The minds that arise from learning and so on

original: ming dang gnyis ka don yul can //
analyzed: ming dang gnyis ka don yul can //
translated: have names, both, and meaning as their objects.🔽They are not for those with two distances, those with insatiable desire,

original: bsring gnyis ldan chog mi shes dang // 'dod chen can la ma yin no //🔽rnyed la yang @19a * //🔽sred chog mi shes //
analyzed: bsring gnyis ldan chog mi shes dang // 'dod chen can la ma yin no // rnyed la yang @19a * // sred chog mi shes //
translated: and those with great desire.🔽Those with insatiable desire🔽are insatiable with regard to acquisition.

original: ma rnyed la 'dod 'dod chen can //
analyzed: ma rnyed la 'dod 'dod chen can //
translated: Those with great desire desire what is not acquired.🔽Their opposites are their antidotes.

original: bzlog pa de yi gnyen po dag / de gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med //
analyzed: bzlog pa de yi gnyen po dag / de gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med //
translated: Those two belong to the three realms and are stainless.

original: ma chags 'phags rigs de dag las //🔽gsum ni chog shes bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ma chags 'phags rigs de dag las // gsum ni chog shes bdag nyid do //
translated: Those ārya clans are nonattachment.🔽Three of them have the nature of contentment.

original: gsum gyis tshul bstan tha mas las //
analyzed: gsum gyis tshul bstan tha mas las //
translated: The last one is taught by the three.

original: sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir //
analyzed: sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir //
translated: In order to be an antidote to the arising of craving,🔽one should have the view of impermanence,🔽the view of suffering, the view of selflessness,🔽and the view of the repulsiveness of food.🔽The first two are for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of permanence and the view of pleasure.🔽The third is for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of purity and the view of self.🔽The last is for the purpose of abandoning

original: bdag gir bdag 'dzin dngos 'dod pa //
analyzed: bdag gir bdag 'dzin dngos 'dod pa //
translated: the view of being a self and the view of being a being.🔽The first two are for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a being and the view of being a person.🔽The last is for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a person and the view of being a master.🔽The first two are for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a master and the view of being a lord.🔽The last is for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a lord and the view of being a maker.🔽The first two are for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a maker and the view of being a creator.🔽The last is for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a creator and the view of being a knower.🔽The first two are for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a knower and the view of being a seer.🔽The last is for the purpose of abandoning

original: de yi dus dang gtan zhi'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi dus dang gtan zhi'i phyir //
translated: the view of being a seer and the view of being a hearer.

original: de la 'jug pa mi sdug pa //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa mi sdug pa //
translated: The first two are for the purpose of abandoning🔽the view of being a hearer and the view of being a feeler.🔽The last is for the

original: dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yis //
analyzed: dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yis //
translated: Mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation

original: 'dod chags rnam rtog lhag rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam rtog lhag rnams so //
translated: is for the purpose of abandoning attachment and other thoughts.

original: keng rus chags bcas thams cad la //
analyzed: keng rus chags bcas thams cad la //
translated: For all who are attached to skeletons,🔽the meditation object increases

original: rus pa rgya mtsho'i bar du ni //
analyzed: rus pa rgya mtsho'i bar du ni //

original: spro zhing sdud pas las dang po //🔽rkang rus nas ni thod phyed bar //
analyzed: spro zhing sdud pas las dang po // rkang rus nas ni thod phyed bar //

original: btang bas sbyang ba byas par bshad //
analyzed: btang bas sbyang ba byas par bshad //

original: smin ma'i bar du sems 'dzin pas //
analyzed: smin ma'i bar du sems 'dzin pas //
translated: By concentrating the mind between the eyebrows,

original: yid la byed pa rdzogs pa yin //
analyzed: yid la byed pa rdzogs pa yin //
translated: the mental activity is complete.🔽Aversionless repulsiveness is on ten levels,

original: mi sdug ma chags sa bcu dang // dmigs pa 'dod snang mis skyed do //
analyzed: mi sdug ma chags sa bcu dang // dmigs pa 'dod snang mis skyed do //
translated: its object appears as repulsiveness, and it is generated by humans.

original: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni //
analyzed: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni //

original: shes rab sa lnga spyod yul rlung //
analyzed: shes rab sa lnga spyod yul rlung //

original: 'dod rten phyi ba'i ma yin ni //
analyzed: 'dod rten phyi ba'i ma yin ni //

original: bgrang la sogs pa rnam pa drug / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung gang las lus //
analyzed: bgrang la sogs pa rnam pa drug / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung gang las lus //

analyzed: sems can zhes bya ma zin pa'o //

original: rgyu mthun las byung 'og ma yi //
analyzed: rgyu mthun las byung 'og ma yi //

original: yid kyis de gnyis ma rtogs so //
analyzed: yid kyis de gnyis ma rtogs so //

original: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //

original: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya //

original: lus tshor sems dang chos rnams la //
analyzed: lus tshor sems dang chos rnams la //

analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyis su yongs brtags pas //

original: shes rab thos sogs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab thos sogs las byung ba'o //

original: gzhan ni 'brel dang dmigs pa las //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'brel dang dmigs pa las //

original: rim ni ji ltar skye ba bzhin //
analyzed: rim ni ji ltar skye ba bzhin //

original: phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //

original: de ni chos dran nyer gzhag pa //
analyzed: de ni chos dran nyer gzhag pa //

original: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
analyzed: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
translated: Abiding in the observation of the general characteristics,

original: de dag la ni mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal stong bdag med par lta //
analyzed: de dag la ni mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal stong bdag med par lta //

original: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung ;
analyzed: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung ;

original: / de ni bden bzhi'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: / de ni bden bzhi'i spyod yul can //

original: rnam pa bcu drug dro ba las //🔽rtse mo de yang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug dro ba las // rtse mo de yang de dang 'dra //

original: gnyis ka chos kyis rnam pa gtod //
analyzed: gnyis ka chos kyis rnam pa gtod //

original: gzhan dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed //

original: de las bzod pa gnyis de bzhin //
analyzed: de las bzod pa gnyis de bzhin //

original: thams cad chos kyis 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: thams cad chos kyis 'phel bar byed //

original: @19b chen po 'dod gtogs sdug bsngal yul //
analyzed: @19b chen po 'dod gtogs sdug bsngal yul //

original: de ni skad cig gcig de bzhin //
analyzed: de ni skad cig gcig de bzhin //

original: chos mchog thams cad phung po lnga //
analyzed: chos mchog thams cad phung po lnga //

original: thob pa ma gtogs de ltar na //
analyzed: thob pa ma gtogs de ltar na //

original: nges 'byed cha mthun rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: nges 'byed cha mthun rnam pa bzhi //

original: bsgoms byung mi lcogs med pa dang // khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms byung mi lcogs med pa dang // khyad par bsam gtan sa pa'o //

original: gnyis ni 'og na'ang yod pa'am //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'og na'ang yod pa'am //

original: 'dod rten chos mchog bud med kyis //
analyzed: 'dod rten chos mchog bud med kyis //

analyzed: gnyis ka'i rten can 'thob par 'gyur // 'phags pas de dag sa bor nas //
translated: When a noble being changes level,🔽he relinquishes them.🔽When a non-noble being dies,

original: gtong ngo 'phags min 'chi bas so //
analyzed: gtong ngo 'phags min 'chi bas so //
translated: he also relinquishes them.

original: dang po gnyis yongs nyams pas kyang /
analyzed: dang po gnyis yongs nyams pas kyang /

original: dngos gzhis de nyid la bden mthong //
analyzed: dngos gzhis de nyid la bden mthong //

original: rnam par nyams tshe sngon med 'thob //
analyzed: rnam par nyams tshe sngon med 'thob //

original: nyams pa gnyis ni mi ldan pa //
analyzed: nyams pa gnyis ni mi ldan pa //

original: rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //
analyzed: rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //

original: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //

original: gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //
analyzed: gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang //

analyzed: ston dang bse ru byang chub bar //

original: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la kun //
analyzed: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la kun //

original: de yi sngon du thar cha mthun //
analyzed: de yi sngon du thar cha mthun //

original: myur ba srid pa gsum gyis thar //
analyzed: myur ba srid pa gsum gyis thar //

original: thos bsams las byung las gsum mo //
analyzed: thos bsams las byung las gsum mo //

original: mi yi nang nas 'phen par byed //
analyzed: mi yi nang nas 'phen par byed //

original: 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las //

analyzed: chos kyi bzod pa zag pa med //

analyzed: 'dod sdug bsngal la de nas ni ; / de nyid la chos shes de bzhin //

analyzed: sdug bsngal lhag la rjes bzod shes //

analyzed: bden pa gsum la'ang de bzhin no //

analyzed: de ltar bden pa mngon rtogs 'di //

analyzed: sems bcu drug go rnam gsum ste //

original: bzod dang shes pa go rims bzhin //
analyzed: bzod dang shes pa go rims bzhin //

original: bar chad med dang rnam grol lam //
analyzed: bar chad med dang rnam grol lam //

original: de la skad cig bco lnga ni //
analyzed: de la skad cig bco lnga ni //
translated: The fifteen moments are

analyzed: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //

original: dbang po rno rtul de dag tu //
analyzed: dbang po rno rtul de dag tu //

analyzed: dad dang chos kyi rjes 'brang ba //

original: bsgoms pas spang bya ma spangs na //
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bya ma spangs na //

analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa// rnam lnga'i bar bcom gnyis pa la //

analyzed: gang zhig gang la zhugs pa ni //

analyzed: dgu pa'i bar chad med lam yang //

analyzed: de ni rdo rje lta bu yin //

original: 'jig rten pa yi rnam grol dang // bar chad med lam go rims bzhin //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rnam grol dang // bar chad med lam go rims bzhin //
translated: is a conqueror of the three realms by the eight liberated paths.🔽One who is

original: zhi sogs rags sogs rnam pa can //
analyzed: zhi sogs rags sogs rnam pa can //
translated: The aspects of the truths are the aspects of the truths of cessation and so on and coarseness and so on.

original: gong dang 'og ma'i spyod yul can //🔽gal te mi g-yo'i zad shes las //🔽mi skye'i blo gros gal te min //
analyzed: gong dang 'og ma'i spyod yul can // gal te mi g-yo'i zad shes las // mi skye'i blo gros gal te min //
translated: They are the objects of higher and lower perception.🔽If one knows the elimination of the summit of existence,🔽one obtains the cognition of nonarising.

original: zad pa shes sam mi slob lta //
analyzed: zad pa shes sam mi slob lta //
translated: If not, one obtains the cognition of elimination or nonlearner cognition.

original: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
analyzed: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
translated: All arhats

original: dge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //
translated: The stainless path is the way of virtue.

original: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: Its results are conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: They are eighty-nine in number.

original: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
analyzed: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
translated: The liberated path is combined with the eliminations.

original: 'bras bu bzhir rnams gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhir rnams gzhag pa ni //
translated: The four results are posited

original: rgyu lnga dag ni srid phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu lnga dag ni srid phyir ro //
translated: because five causes are possible.🔽The results are the relinquishment of the former path,🔽the obtainment of another, the combination of eliminations,🔽the obtainment of the eight types of cognition,

original: 'bras la sngon lam btang ba dang // gzhan thob pa dang zad bsdoms dang // shes pa brgyad tshan thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras la sngon lam btang ba dang // gzhan thob pa dang zad bsdoms dang // shes pa brgyad tshan thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'o //
translated: and the obtainment of the sixteen aspects.

original: 'jig rten pa yis thob 'bras ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis thob 'bras ni //
translated: The results obtained by mundane beings

original: bsres dang zad med thob 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: bsres dang zad med thob 'dzin phyir //
translated: are mixed and not exhausted because they are maintained.

original: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
translated: That itself is the way of Brahma, because it is Brahma.

original: 'khor lo tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
translated: It is the wheel of Brahma because it is turned by Brahma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The wheel of Dharma is the path of seeing.

original: myur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs kyis //
analyzed: myur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs kyis //
translated: The wheel of Dharma is so called because it is like a wheel in that it moves quickly and so forth, and in that it has spokes and so on.

original: 'dod par gsum 'thob tha ma ni //
analyzed: 'dod par gsum 'thob tha ma ni //
translated: Three are obtained in the desire realm.

original: gsum du'o gong na mthong lam med //🔽mi skyo lung las 'dir rtsom zhing //
analyzed: gsum du'o gong na mthong lam med // mi skyo lung las 'dir rtsom zhing //
translated: The last is also in three. There is no path of seeing in higher realms.🔽It is not that one is not discouraged, because a sutra declares:

original: der mthar phyin ces 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: der mthar phyin ces 'byung phyir ro //
translated: One begins here and completes there.

original: dgra bcom drug 'dod de dag las //
analyzed: dgra bcom drug 'dod de dag las //
translated: It is asserted that there are six arhats.

original: lnga ni dad pas mos las skyes //
analyzed: lnga ni dad pas mos las skyes //
translated: Five are born from resolute faith.

original: de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
analyzed: de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
translated: They are liberated according to circumstances.

original: mi g-yo'i chos can mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: mi g-yo'i chos can mi g-yo ba //
translated: The immutable arhat is immutable.

original: de phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
analyzed: de phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
translated: Therefore he is liberated regardless of circumstances.

original: de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
analyzed: de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
translated: He is one who obtains results by insight.

original: kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs //
analyzed: kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs //
translated: Some are of that type from the beginning.

original: kha cig sbyangs pa las gyur to //
analyzed: kha cig sbyangs pa las gyur to //
translated: Some become that through training.

original: bzhi ni rigs las lnga 'bras la //
analyzed: bzhi ni rigs las lnga 'bras la //
translated: Four are from the type, five from the result.

original: nyams 'gyur dang po las ma @21a * //
analyzed: nyams 'gyur dang po las ma @21a * //
translated: The first does not degenerate.

original: yin ; / slob dang 'phags min rigs drug ldan //
analyzed: yin ; / slob dang 'phags min rigs drug ldan //
translated: The learner and the nonārya possess six types.

original: mthong ba la ni 'pho ba med //🔽thob dang ma thob nyer spyad las //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni 'pho ba med // thob dang ma thob nyer spyad las //
translated: There is no change in the path of seeing.🔽Degeneration is of three types:

original: yongs nyams rnam pa gsum shes bya //
analyzed: yongs nyams rnam pa gsum shes bya //
translated: from obtainment, nonobtainment, and enjoyment.

original: ston la tha ma mi g-yo la //
analyzed: ston la tha ma mi g-yo la //
translated: The last is in autumn, the middle in summer, and the first in spring.

original: bar ma'ang gzhan la rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: bar ma'ang gzhan la rnam gsum mo //
translated: The middle one is in the other two.

original: 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
analyzed: 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
translated: One does not die through degeneration of the result.

original: bya ba ma yin de mi byed //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin de mi byed //
translated: One does not commit actions that should not be done.

original: mi g-yo rnam grol bar chad med //
analyzed: mi g-yo rnam grol bar chad med //
translated: The unshakable are liberated without remainder.

original: lam dgu'o shin tu bsten phyir ro //
analyzed: lam dgu'o shin tu bsten phyir ro //
translated: The path is ninefold because it is fully relied upon.

original: mthong bas thob la re re'o //
analyzed: mthong bas thob la re re'o //
translated: One who obtains results by insight has one.

original: zag med mi yi nang du 'phel //
analyzed: zag med mi yi nang du 'phel //
translated: One who is not a trainee increases in the desire realm.

original: mi slob sa dgu la bsten te //
analyzed: mi slob sa dgu la bsten te //
translated: One who is not a trainee relies on nine levels.

original: slob pa drug la gang gi phyir //
analyzed: slob pa drug la gang gi phyir //
translated: One who is a trainee relies on six.

original: 'phel ba 'bras bu khyad par can //
analyzed: 'phel ba 'bras bu khyad par can //
translated: One who is a trainee increases in the special result.

original: btang ste 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: btang ste 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
translated: One who is a trainee obtains the result by abandoning.

original: sangs rgyas gnyis dang nyan thos bdun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnyis dang nyan thos bdun //
translated: The two buddhas and the seven śrāvakas

original: de dgu dbang po rnam dgu can //
analyzed: de dgu dbang po rnam dgu can //
translated: are the nine with nine faculties.

original: gang zag bdun po sbyor ba dang // dbang po snyoms 'jug rnam grol dang // gnyis kas byas pa'o de dag drug /'di ltar lam gsum la gnyis gnyis //
analyzed: gang zag bdun po sbyor ba dang // dbang po snyoms 'jug rnam grol dang // gnyis kas byas pa'o de dag drug /'di ltar lam gsum la gnyis gnyis //
translated: The seven persons are those who are liberated according to circumstances, those liberated by the two, those liberated by wisdom, those liberated by both, those who are liberated from one, those liberated from both, and those liberated from all.

original: 'gog thob gnyis ka las rnam grol //
analyzed: 'gog thob gnyis ka las rnam grol //
translated: Those who obtain cessation are liberated from both.

original: shes rab kyis ni cig shos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni cig shos so //
translated: The others are liberated by wisdom.

original: snyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyis //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyis //
translated: Those who obtain results by insight are of three types: those who obtain results by insight and then enter meditative attainment, those who enter meditative attainment and then obtain results by insight, and those who obtain results by insight and enter meditative attainment simultaneously.

original: slob pa yongs rdzogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob pa yongs rdzogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of completion is called “the path of the perfected being in training.”

original: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
translated: The path of no more learning is perfected through the other two.

original: mdor na lam ni rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: mdor na lam ni rnam bzhi ste //
translated: In brief, the path is fourfold:🔽the special path, the path of liberation,

original: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya //
analyzed: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya //
translated: the uninterrupted path, and the path of preparation.

original: bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
translated: The paths of the absorptions are easy.

original: sa gzhan dag gi dka' ba yin //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag gi dka' ba yin //
translated: The paths of other levels are difficult.

original: blo rtul mngon shes bul ba ste //
analyzed: blo rtul mngon shes bul ba ste //
translated: Those of dull faculty have slow superknowledge.

original: cig shos kyi ni mngon shes myur //
analyzed: cig shos kyi ni mngon shes myur //
translated: Those of sharp faculty have quick superknowledge.

original: zad dang mi skye shes pa ni //
analyzed: zad dang mi skye shes pa ni //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonarising

original: byang chub de dang mthun nyid phyir //
analyzed: byang chub de dang mthun nyid phyir //
translated: is enlightenment, because it is concordant with it.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun //
translated: The thirty-seven factors are concordant with it.

original: ming gi sgo nas rdzas su bcu //
analyzed: ming gi sgo nas rdzas su bcu //
translated: They are ten in substance, but eleven in name.🔽Faith, effort, mindfulness,

original: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin btang snyoms dga' //
analyzed: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin btang snyoms dga' //
translated: wisdom, concentration, equanimity, joy,

original: rtog dang tshul khrims shin tu sbyangs //
analyzed: rtog dang tshul khrims shin tu sbyangs //
translated: thought, and the purification of ethics.

original: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
translated: Effort is called right exertion.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting 'dzin to //
translated: The bases of miraculous powers are concentration.

original: gtso bo smos pa de dag ni //
analyzed: gtso bo smos pa de dag ni //
translated: These are the principal ones.

original: sbyor byung yon tan kun kyang yin //
analyzed: sbyor byung yon tan kun kyang yin //
translated: They are also all the qualities derived from preparation.

original: sde tshan bdun ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: sde tshan bdun ni go rims bzhin //
translated: The seven groups are respectively

original: las ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
analyzed: las ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
translated: The stages of action, the aids to penetration,

original: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
analyzed: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
translated: The path of meditation, and the path of seeing.

original: byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / zag pa med gzhan rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / zag pa med gzhan rnam gnyis so //
translated: The branches of enlightenment and the path are two other uncontaminated faculties.

original: bsam gtan dang po na thams cad //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na thams cad //
translated: All exist in the first absorption.

original: mi lcogs med na dga' ma gtogs //
analyzed: mi lcogs med na dga' ma gtogs //
translated: In unrestricted access concentration, joy is excluded.

original: gnyis pa na @21b ni rtog ma gtogs //
analyzed: gnyis pa na @21b ni rtog ma gtogs //
translated: In the second, investigation is excluded.

original: gnyis na de gnyis ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: gnyis na de gnyis ma gtogs pa //
translated: In the two, both are excluded.

original: bsam gtan bar na'ang gzugs med pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan bar na'ang gzugs med pa //
translated: In the absorptions and formless states,🔽The branches of investigation and joy are excluded.🔽In the third, the branches of enlightenment and the path are excluded.

original: gsum na'ang de dang tshul yan lag / byang chub dang ni lam yan lag / ma gtogs 'dod khams srid rtse na //
analyzed: gsum na'ang de dang tshul yan lag / byang chub dang ni lam yan lag / ma gtogs 'dod khams srid rtse na //
translated: In the desire realm and the summit of existence,🔽The three views of the truth of path🔽Are the faith of knowing ethics and the teachings.

original: bden gsum mthong na tshul khrims dang // chos la shes nas dad pa 'thob ;
analyzed: bden gsum mthong na tshul khrims dang // chos la shes nas dad pa 'thob ;
translated: When the three truths are seen,

original: / lam mngon rtogs na sangs rgyas dang // de yi dge 'dun dag la yang //
analyzed: / lam mngon rtogs na sangs rgyas dang // de yi dge 'dun dag la yang //
translated: One obtains faith in the Buddha and his Sangha.

original: chos bden gsum dang rang sangs rgyas //
analyzed: chos bden gsum dang rang sangs rgyas //
translated: The three truths of the Dharma and the pratyekabuddha

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no //
translated: The path of the bodhisattva is the path of seeing.

original: rdzas su gnyis te dad pa dang // tshul khrims dri ma med pa yin //
analyzed: rdzas su gnyis te dad pa dang // tshul khrims dri ma med pa yin //
translated: In substance, it is twofold: faith and stainless morality.

original: bcings phyir slob pa'i yan lag tu //
analyzed: bcings phyir slob pa'i yan lag tu //
translated: The limbs of the learner are not explained as liberation because they are bound.🔽Liberation is twofold.

original: rnam grol ma bshad de rnam gnyis //🔽nyon mongs bcom pa 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: rnam grol ma bshad de rnam gnyis // nyon mongs bcom pa 'dus ma byas //
translated: The destruction of the defilements is unconditioned.

original: mos pa 'dus byas yan lag ni //
analyzed: mos pa 'dus byas yan lag ni //
translated: Faith is conditioned.🔽It is the limbs of the learner.

original: de yin de nyid rnam grol gnyis //🔽byang chub ji skad bshad ces pa //
analyzed: de yin de nyid rnam grol gnyis // byang chub ji skad bshad ces pa //
translated: Liberation is twofold.

original: mi slob sems ni skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mi slob sems ni skye 'gyur ba //
translated: The enlightenment explained above is the nonlearner’s mind.

original: sgrib pa las ni rnam grol 'gyur //
analyzed: sgrib pa las ni rnam grol 'gyur //
translated: It is liberation from the obscurations.🔽The path of cessation

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //🔽de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni // de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong //
translated: completely abandons the obscurations.

original: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
translated: The unconditioned itself is called the element.

original: 'dod chags kun zad 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: 'dod chags kun zad 'dod chags bral //
translated: The element of separation is the complete exhaustion of attachment.

original: spangs pa'i khams ni gzhan dag go //
analyzed: spangs pa'i khams ni gzhan dag go //
translated: The other elements are the elements of abandonment.

original: 'gog pa'i khams zhes bya ba gzhi //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams zhes bya ba gzhi //
translated: The basis of the element of cessation🔽is the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the desire realm.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu bzod shes rnams kyis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu bzod shes rnams kyis //
translated: By the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the higher realms,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the cessation and path of the desire realm,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the cessation and path of the higher realms,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the desire realm,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the cessation and path of the desire realm,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the higher realms,

original: yid 'byung gang gis spong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: yid 'byung gang gis spong 'gyur ba //
translated: one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the cessation and path of the higher realms,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the desire realm,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the cessation and path of the desire realm,

original: kun gyi 'dod chags 'bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: kun gyi 'dod chags 'bral bar 'gyur //
translated: one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the higher realms,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the cessation and path of the higher realms,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the desire realm,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the cessation and path of the desire realm,🔽one is disgusted and abandons them.🔽By the patience and knowledge of the suffering and origin of the higher realms,🔽one

original: de ltar na ni mu bzhi srid //🔽chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las //
analyzed: de ltar na ni mu bzhi srid // chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi tshig le'ur byas pa las //
translated: Thus, the four possibilities are possible.

original: lam dang gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba ste gnas drug pa'o /
analyzed: lam dang gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba ste gnas drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter, on the presentation of the path and the person, in the Treatise on the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: // / dri med bzod rnams shes pa min //
analyzed: // / dri med bzod rnams shes pa min //
translated: The stainless forbearances are not knowledge.

original: zad dang mi skye'i blo lta min //
analyzed: zad dang mi skye'i blo lta min //
translated: The awareness of elimination and nonarising are not seeing.

original: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyis ka ;
analyzed: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyis ka ;
translated: The other two noble awarenesses are both.

original: / gzhan shes drug ni lta ba'ang yin //
analyzed: / gzhan shes drug ni lta ba'ang yin //
translated: The other six knowledges are also seeing.

original: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: Knowledge is either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o //🔽zag med rnam gnyis chos dang ni //
analyzed: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o // zag med rnam gnyis chos dang ni //
translated: The first is called conventional.🔽The uncontaminated is twofold:

original: rjes su shes pa kho na yin //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa kho na yin //
translated: it is Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do //
translated: Conventional knowledge has all as its object.

original: chos zhes bya ba'i spyod yul ni //🔽'dod sdug bsngal sogs rjes shes pa'i //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i spyod yul ni // 'dod sdug bsngal sogs rjes shes pa'i //
translated: The object of Dharma knowledge🔽is the suffering of the desire realm and so on.

original: spyod yul gong ma'i sdug bsngal sogs //
analyzed: spyod yul gong ma'i sdug bsngal sogs //
translated: The object of subsequent knowledge is the suffering of the higher realms and so on.

original: de dag nyid bden bye brag gis //🔽bzhi ste rnam bzhi de dag ni //
analyzed: de dag nyid bden bye brag gis // bzhi ste rnam bzhi de dag ni //
translated: Those two are divided by way of the four truths.

original: mi skye ba dang zad pa shes //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang zad pa shes //
translated: The four are the knowledge of nonarising and the knowledge of elimination.

original: de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
analyzed: de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
translated: The first of those two arises

original: sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin //
translated: It is knowledge of the cause and result of suffering.

original: bzhi las pha rol sems rig pa //🔽des ni sa dbang gang zag 'das //
analyzed: bzhi las pha rol sems rig pa // des ni sa dbang gang zag 'das //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is from four.🔽It does not know the minds of those on higher levels, of those in the future,

original: zhig dang ma skyes @22a * //🔽mi rig go //
analyzed: zhig dang ma skyes @22a * // mi rig go //
translated: Or of those who have disintegrated or not yet arisen.

original: chos rjes blo phyogs phan tshun min //
analyzed: chos rjes blo phyogs phan tshun min //
translated: Knowledge of phenomena does not know minds of its own level or higher.

original: nyan thos mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis //
analyzed: nyan thos mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis //
translated: Sravakas know two moments of seeing.

original: rig ste bse ru lta bus gsum //
analyzed: rig ste bse ru lta bus gsum //
translated: Rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas know three.

original: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med par kun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med par kun //
translated: Buddhas know all without preparation.

original: zad par shes pa bden rnams la //
